column4: i would say yes, but it doesnt show up in restricted drivers :\

VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation GeForce 8400M GS (rev a1)
Might try a google search on how to make this work in Ubuntu - using Intrepid ibeck - are you?
itrepid ibeck? no..whats that?
ahh...Im still with 8.04
Latest version of Ubuntu - just came out for release on Friday 10/31/08
You can type in cat /etc/issue in a Terminal window and it will tell you what version of linux ububntu yopu are running.
Ubuntu 8.04.1
ok - so any luck searching google for how to get to show up in restricted drivers?
everyone says apt-get install nvidia-glx, reboot and it should show up...
I will reboot, brb
If that doesn't work here is a link for ya - http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=5086971&postcount=6
I was booting with another kernel, since I installed ubuntu audio studio, I got the rt-kernel
I see you're back on now - get your Nvidia to show up ?
I was booting with another kernel, since I installed ubuntu audio studio, I got the rt-kernel
so it got mixed up, real time and generic...but its working now for real time kernel
thanks your time and patience :)
Cool - good to hear it - Linux can be so much more exacting then windows - but that's ok - way allot better by far by far
np
yes I've been using it since a couple of years :) c ya around!
